titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. M. C. O'Connell, Indictment
CWG11144

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Ky.
Montgomery circuit ct.
Commonwealth
vs. } Indictt for Keeping a Tippling house
M. C. OConnell

Indictment
The Grand Jury of Montomery County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Ky. accuse M. C. OConnell of the offense of Keeping a Tippling House. Committed as follows To Wit. The said M. C. OConnell on the 1st day of March 1859 in the county & circuit aforesaid and on diverse days since Kept a Tippling House against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Ky.

Remarks
The above was endorsed a true bill by Wm Bridges Foreman of the Grand Jury, and filed in open Court 21st February 1860 at the Feby. court 1861. the Jury found the Deft. guilty and he was fined $60. & costs

The proof showing only one case of selling. The Gov. of Ky. respited the fine in this case for one year, which respite is about to expire. OConnell has paid all the fees and costs and asks for the amount of the fine to be
remitted by his Excellency the Governor. We think the same should be done and respectfully now here request it to be done.

J. M Crawford C. M. C. C.
J. E. Clarke D. C.
Thos. Turner
James H. French P J C C
Jno W White
O. S. Tenny
I do not ^know^ what the evidence was & therefore cant say, but Mr O'connell is a clever man & I would be pleased that the fine should be remitted

R Apperson
Tho. F. Hazelrigg
K Farrow
J. S. Hood

Montgomery Cir. Ct.
$60. } Tipling
M. C. OConnell
Remission Issd Feby 12. 1862
